title.narrative: Zaman Tare project - Action for interreligious and intercultural tolerance - operational support

description.narrative: Nigeria and Niger are multi-ethnic, multi-lingual and multi-religious countries. The culture of both countries is shaped by its diverse groups; hence, religion is conflated with ethnicity and regionalism. In the Call for Proposals, intercultural dialogue may include interreligious, intra-faith or interfaith dialogue. The action addresses this by enhancing understanding and respect for cultural and religious diversity. It’s strong focus on interreligious dialogue encourages the interaction between different religious denominations, particularly Islam and Christianity. However, traditional African beliefs and practices, which tend to be practised by practitioners of both Christianity and Islam, also play an important role in the target communities, sometimes causing conflict within the same denomination. The action will hence also have a positive impact on intra-faith dialogue. To reflect and understand the challenges communities are facing are neither solely cultural nor religious the language ‘intercultural and interreligious pluralism’ The University of Jos seeks dive into a deep rooted research on the barriers and enablers of cultural and religious pluralism in Plateau State.
